Now I=92m totally confused, what=92s the laspots that Ihave to take in coun=
t?


From: Super Cyclonus 
Sent: Monday, January 24, 2011 2:47 PM
To: nbwrp=
g 
Subject: Re: Wicked Blades in the Dark!!



Sounds good, and as far as w=
hat Tuscon intends, I don't mind running with that intention and seeing whe=
re things land :) 

I will let Airly post for Hydras and crew before I post=
. 

Oh, and I sent you some private email :)

Preston




On Sun, Jan 23, 2=
011 at 8:16 PM, Sandy <magicquartz@...> wrote:

    
  You were right=
. I did delete that post and I rewrote it. Tucson hasn't moved, he's signal=
led Noctorro to move in slowly, and in phases. He's going to now stand back=
 and let the fuzors begin their work. But he's also going to give the impre=
ssion of complete surrender at the same time. 

  Meanwhile, Uproar and Qui=
ckstride are completely at a loss as to how to fix things at the Ark. And n=
ow, they're going to look up to Rodimus to do the right thing. Both of them=
 are rookie Maximals, so do expect some comic relief from those two. Uproar=
s biggest weakness is his perpetual curiosity which is harmless enough but =
often gets him into sticky situations. Quickstride's weakness is often his =
scatterbrained nature, which also provides a little comic relief. If Rodimu=
s can put these two guys on the right track, then he shouldn't have any rea=
sons to doubt himself as a leader.

  Hope this helps. BTW, Tucson is willi=
ng to meet with Legacy, on neutral grounds, but feels it's best that Legacy=
 does leave the Ark for saftey purposes. Remember, he does have that weakne=
ss for losing his temper, and he may have made it sound rather harsh, when =
he informed Legacy that he was to vacate the Ark. But in doing so, he could=
 privately meet with the bot to try and get an idea as to what page he's ac=
tually on, and why he's doing what he's doing. And if he has indeed turned =
evil. Tucson is extremely confused as to why Legacy would intentionally har=
m his comrades, and he's hiding confusion behind his anger. But he will not=
 make any violent actions against him, he just wants honest answers. 

  Ok=
ay, that's definitely it for now. Haven't gone this far yet, just something=
 to run by you before we go with it.



  --- In mailto:nbwrpg%40yahoogroup=
s.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
  >

  > OOC: Okay, I am c=
onfused.
  > 
  > Sandy I am not trying to be critical, so please don't tak=
e it that way, but
  > your post is sort of unfair. You start your post wit=
h Tuscon in the middle
  > of a very tense stand off with him being defensl=
ess and you end it with him
  > being on the way to the Ark. Basically you =
made no allowance for someone,
  > presumably Hydras, to stop Tuscon from l=
eaving - which is what most evil bad
  > guys would do.

apons if they wanted Nightlight to live.
  >

gives the order for all the Maximals and such to

st you write that Night Shift subspaces his weapon, as

ansforms into her robot mode, disarming her own weaponry as
  > well.
  > 
=

 and
  > Talon do the same.
  > 
  > This would mean that all of the Maxima=
ls and Autobots in that area are now
  > weaponless, and so pretty much def=
enceless. At the same time much of the
  > Predacon army is standing there,=
 either in front of them, or flying over
  > head. I had posted that the pr=
eds were picking up those discarded weapons
  > while other were watching.
=
  > 
  > However in message #70988 Tuscon is able to pick up a weapon, aim =
it at
  > someone, then with the help of the other Maximals choose not to f=
ire, they
  > are able to talk back and forth a few times, salute each othe=
r and then
  > Tuscon drives off with no one stopping him.
  > 
  > How do =
we reconcile all of that? Since you already had Tuscon sending
  > messages=
 out and your characters already responding, if we had someone stop
  > you=
 in the middle of all of that, it would make it confusing as to what
  > ha=
ppened and what didn't.
  > 
  > Tuscon should not have been able to point =
a weapon, talk, transform and
  > drive away with no response. Does that ma=
ke sense? Anything we post in the
  > middle of that would only confuse thi=
ngs worse.
  > 
  > We might need some editing. Like Tuscon just does the f=
irst part of that,
  > but not leave yet. Allow the rest of us to post a re=
sponse first, then if it
  > is reasonable based on the responses he leaves=
?
  > 
  > Again, not trying to to be critical, but keeping it fair.
  > 
 =
 > Preston

  <P>You were right. =
I did delete that post and I rewrote it. Tucson hasn't 
  moved, he's signa=
lled Noctorro to move in slowly, and in phases. He's going to 
  now stand =
back and let the fuzors begin their work. But he's also going to 
  give th=
e impression of complete surrender at the same time. <BR><BR>Meanwhile, 
  =
Uproar and Quickstride are completely at a loss as to how to fix things at =
the 
  Ark. And now, they're going to look up to Rodimus to do the right th=
ing. Both 
  of them are rookie Maximals, so do expect some comic relief fr=
om those two. 
  Uproars biggest weakness is his perpetual curiosity which =
is harmless enough 
  but often gets him into sticky situations. Quickstrid=
e's weakness is often his 
  scatterbrained nature, which also provides a l=
ittle comic relief. If Rodimus 
  can put these two guys on the right track=
, then he shouldn't have any reasons 
  to doubt himself as a leader.<BR><B=
R>Hope this helps. BTW, Tucson is willing 
  to meet with Legacy, on neutra=
l grounds, but feels it's best that Legacy does 
  leave the Ark for saftey=
 purposes. Remember, he does have that weakness for 
  losing his temper, a=
nd he may have made it sound rather harsh, when he 
  informed Legacy that =
he was to vacate the Ark. But in doing so, he could 
  privately meet with =
the bot to try and get an idea as to what page he's 
  actually on, and why=
 he's doing what he's doing. And if he has indeed turned 
  evil. Tucson is=
 extremely confused as to why Legacy would intentionally harm 
  his comrad=
es, and he's hiding confusion behind his anger. But he will not make 
  any=
 violent actions against him, he just wants honest answers. <BR><BR>Okay, 
=
  that's definitely it for now. Haven't gone this far yet, just something t=
o run 
  by you before we go with it.</P>
